member.name: T:Semver.Comparers.ISemVersionComparer
member.summary: An interface that combines equality and order comparison for the class.
member.remarks: This interface provides a type for the and so that separate properties aren't needed for the and of .

member.name: T:Semver.MetadataIdentifier
member.summary: An individual metadata identifier for a semantic version.

remarks.para: The metadata for a semantic version is composed of dot ('.') separated identifiers. A valid identifier is a non-empty string of ASCII alphanumeric and hyphen characters ([0-9A-Za-z-]). Metadata identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order.
Because is a struct, the default value is a with a value. However, the namespace types do not accept and will not return such a .
Invalid metadata identifiers including arbitrary Unicode characters and empty string can currently be produced by the constructor. Such identifiers are compared via an ordinal string comparision.

member.name: P:Semver.MetadataIdentifier.Value
member.summary: The string value of the metadata identifier.
member.value: The string value of this metadata identifier or if this is a default .

member.name: M:Semver.MetadataIdentifier.CreateLoose(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a potentially invalid .
member.exception: The parameter is .
member.remarks: This should only be used by the constructor that still accepts illegal values.

member.name: M:Semver.MetadataIdentifier.CreateUnsafe(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a without checking that any of the invariants hold. Used by the parser for performance.
member.remarks: This is a create method rather than a constructor to clearly indicate uses of it. The other constructors have not been hidden behind create methods because only constructors are visible to the package users. So they see a class consistently using constructors without any create methods.

member.param: The value for the identifier. Not validated.
Unused parameter that differentiates this from the constructor that performs validation.

member.returns:
An integer that indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or is equal to in sort order.
Value Condition
-1 This instance precedes .
0 This instance is equal to .

member.name: T:Semver.PrereleaseIdentifier
member.summary: An individual prerelease identifier for a semantic version.

remarks.para: The prerelease portion of a semantic version is composed of dot ('.') separated identifiers. A prerelease identifier is either an alphanumeric or numeric identifier. A valid numeric identifier is composed of ASCII digits ([0-9]) without leading zeros. A valid alphanumeric identifier is a non-empty string of ASCII alphanumeric and hyphen characters ([0-9A-Za-z-]) with at least one non-digit character. Prerelease identifiers are compared first by whether they are numeric or alphanumeric. Numeric identifiers have lower precedence than alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared to each other numerically. Alphanumeric identifiers are compared to each other lexically in ASCII sort order.
Because is a struct, the default value is a with a value. However, the namespace types do not accept and will not return such a .

Invalid prerelease identifiers including arbitrary Unicode characters, empty string, and numeric identifiers with leading zero can currently be produced by the constructor and the obsolete and methods. Such alphanumeric identifiers are compared via an ordinal string comparision. Numeric identifiers with leading zeros are considered equal (e.g. '15' is equal to '015').

member.name: P:Semver.PrereleaseIdentifier.Value
member.summary: The string value of the prerelease identifier even if it is a numeric identifier.
member.value: The string value of this prerelease identifier even if it is a numeric identifier or if this is a default .
member.remarks: Invalid numeric prerelease identifiers with leading zeros will have a string value including the leading zeros. This can be used to distinguish invalid numeric identifiers with different numbers of leading zeros.

member.name: P:Semver.PrereleaseIdentifier.NumericValue
member.summary: The numeric value of the prerelease identifier if it is a numeric identifier, otherwise .
member.value: The numeric value of the prerelease identifier if it is a numeric identifier, otherwise .
member.remarks: The numeric value of a prerelease identifier will never be negative.

member.summary: Compares two identifiers and indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or is equal to the other in precedence order.
member.returns:
An integer that indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or is equal to in precedence order.
Value Condition

member.remarks: Numeric identifiers have lower precedence than alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared numerically. Numeric identifiers with leading zeros are considered equal (e.g. '15' is equal to '015'). Alphanumeric identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. Invalid alphanumeric identifiers are compared via an ordinal string comparision.

Invalid alphanumeric identifiers are compared via an ordinal string comparision.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class from a .
member.param: used to initialize the major, minor, and patch version numbers and the build metadata.
member.exception: The is null.
member.remarks: Constructs a with the same major and minor version numbers. The patch version number will be the fourth component of the . The build meta data will contain the third component of the if it is greater than zero.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Semver.PrereleaseIdentifier},System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Semver.MetadataIdentifier})
member.summary: Construct a from its proper parts.
member.remarks: Parameter validation is not performed. The , , and version numbers must not be negative. The and must not be or contain invalid values and must be immutable. The and must not be null and must be equal to the corresponding identifiers.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.FromVersion(System.Version)
member.summary: Converts a into the equivalent semantic version.
member.param: The version to be converted to a semantic version.
member.returns: The equivalent semantic version.
member.exception: is .
has a revision number greater than zero.
member.remarks: numbers have the form major.minor[.build[.revision]] where square brackets ('[' and ']') indicate optional components. The first three parts are converted to the major, minor, and patch version numbers of a semantic version. If the build component is not defined (-1), the patch number is assumed to be zero. numbers with a revision greater than zero cannot be converted to semantic versions. An is thrown when this method is called with such a .

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.ToVersion
member.summary: Converts this semantic version to a .
member.returns: The equivalent .
member.exception: The semantic version is a prerelease version or has build metadata or has a negative major, minor, or patch version number.
member.remarks: A semantic version of the form major.minor.patch is converted to a of the form major.minor.build where the build number is the patch version of the semantic version. Prerelease versions and build metadata are not representable in a . This method throws an if the semantic version is a prerelease version or has build metadata.

members.member:
Converts the string representation of a semantic version to its equivalent. The return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
The version string. A bitwise combination of enumeration values that indicates the style elements that can be present in . The preferred value to use is .4 When this method returns, contains a instance equivalent to the version string passed in, if the version string was valid, or if the version string was invalid. The maximum length of that should be parsed. This prevents attacks using very long version strings.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.TryParse(System.String,Semver.SemVersion@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a semantic version to its equivalent. The return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: The version string.
When this method returns, contains a instance equivalent to the version string passed in, if the version string was valid, or if the version string was invalid.
If set to , minor and patch version numbers are required; otherwise they are optional.
member.returns: when a invalid version string is passed, otherwise .

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.Compare(Semver.SemVersion,Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Compares two versions and indicates whether the first precedes, follows, or is equal to the other in the sort order. Note that sort order is more specific than precedence order.
member.returns:
An integer that indicates whether precedes, follows, or is equal to in the sort order.
Value Condition
Less than zero precedes in the sort order.
Zero is equal to .
Greater than zero
follows in the sort order or is .

remarks.para: Sort order is consistent with precedence order, but provides an order for versions with the same precedence. Sort order is determined by comparing the major, minor, patch, prerelease portion, and build metadata in order from left to right. The major, minor, and patch version numbers are compared numerically. A prerelease version precedes a release version.

The prerelease portion is compared by comparing each prerelease identifier from left to right. Numeric prerelease identifiers precede alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared numerically. Alphanumeric identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. A longer series of prerelease identifiers follows a shorter series if all the preceding identifiers are equal.

Otherwise equal versions without build metadata precede those with metadata. The build metadata is compared by comparing each metadata identifier. Identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. A longer series of metadata identifiers follows a shorter series if all the preceding identifiers are equal.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.Change(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Make a copy of the current instance with changed properties.
member.param: The value to replace the major version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the minor version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the patch version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the prerelease portion or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the build metadata or to leave it unchanged.
member.returns: The new version with changed properties.
member.remarks: The change method is intended to be called using named argument syntax, passing only those fields to be changed.
member.example: To change only the patch version: var changedVersion = version.Change(patch: 4);

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.With(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Semver.PrereleaseIdentifier},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Semver.MetadataIdentifier})
member.summary: Creates a copy of the current instance with multiple changed properties. If changing only one property use one of the more specific WithX() methods.
member.param: The value to replace the major version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the minor version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the patch version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the prerelease identifiers or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the build metadata identifiers or to leave it unchanged.
member.returns: The new version with changed properties.
member.exception: A , , or version number is negative.
A prerelease or metadata identifier has the default value.
A numeric prerelease identifier value is too large for .
member.remarks: The method is intended to be called using named argument syntax, passing only those fields to be changed.
member.example: To change the minor and patch versions: var modifiedVersion = version.With(minor: 2, patch: 4);

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.WithParsedFrom(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a copy of the current instance with multiple changed properties. Parses prerelease and metadata identifiers from dot separated strings. Use instead if parsing is not needed. If changing only one property use one of the more specific WithX() methods.
member.param: The value to replace the major version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the minor version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the patch version number or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the prerelease identifiers or to leave it unchanged.
The value to replace the build metadata identifiers or to leave it unchanged.
Allow leading zeros in numeric prerelease identifiers. Leading zeros will be removed.
member.returns: The new version with changed properties.
member.exception: A , , or version number is negative.

A prerelease identifier is empty or contains invalid characters (i.e. characters that are not ASCII alphanumerics or hyphens) or has leading zeros for a numeric identifier when is . Or, a metadata identifier is empty or contains invalid characters (i.e. characters that are not ASCII alphanumerics or hyphens).
A numeric prerelease identifier value is too large for .
member.remarks: The method is intended to be called using named argument syntax, passing only those fields to be changed.
member.example: To change the patch version and prerelease identifiers version: var modifiedVersion = version.WithParsedFrom(patch: 4, prerelease: "alpha.5");

member.exception: is or one of the metadata identifiers is .

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.WithoutMetadata
member.summary: Creates a copy of the current instance without build metadata.
member.returns: The new version without build metadata.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.WithoutPrereleaseOrMetadata
member.summary: Creates a copy of the current instance without prerelease identifiers or build metadata.
member.returns: The new version without prerelease identifiers or build metadata.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.Major
member.summary: The major version number.
member.remarks: An increase in the major version number indicates a backwards incompatible change.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.Minor
member.summary: The minor version number.
member.remarks: An increase in the minor version number indicates backwards compatible changes.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.Patch
member.summary: The patch version number.
member.remarks: An increase in the patch version number indicates backwards compatible bug fixes.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.Prerelease
member.summary: The prerelease identifiers for this version.
member.value: The prerelease identifiers for this version or empty string if this is a release version.

remarks.para: A prerelease version is denoted by appending a hyphen ('-') and a series of dot separated identifiers immediately following the patch version number. Each prerelease identifier may be numeric or alphanumeric. Valid numeric identifiers consist of ASCII digits ([0-9]) without leading zeros. Valid alphanumeric identifiers are non-empty strings of ASCII alphanumeric and hyphen characters ([0-9A-Za-z-]) with at least one non-digit character.

Prerelease versions have lower precedence than release versions. Prerelease version precedence is determined by comparing each prerelease identifier in order from left to right. Numeric identifiers have lower precedence than alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared numerically. Alphanumeric identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.PrereleaseIdentifiers
member.summary: The prerelease identifiers for this version.
member.value: The prerelease identifiers for this version or empty if this is a release version.

remarks.para: A prerelease version is denoted by appending a hyphen ('-') and a series of dot separated identifiers immediately following the patch version number. Each prerelease identifier may be numeric or alphanumeric. Valid numeric identifiers consist of ASCII digits ([0-9]) without leading zeros. Valid alphanumeric identifiers are non-empty strings of ASCII alphanumeric and hyphen characters ([0-9A-Za-z-]) with at least one non-digit character.

Prerelease versions have lower precedence than release versions. Prerelease version precedence is determined by comparing each prerelease identifier in order from left to right. Numeric identifiers have lower precedence than alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared numerically. Alphanumeric identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.IsPrerelease
member.summary: Whether this is a prerelease version.
member.value: Whether this is a prerelease version. A semantic version with prerelease identifiers is a prerelease version.
member.remarks: When this is , the and properties are non-empty. When this is , the property will be an empty string and the will be an empty collection.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.IsRelease
member.summary: Whether this is a release version.
member.value: Whether this is a release version. A semantic version without prerelease identifiers is a release version.
member.remarks: When this is , the property will be an empty string and the will be an empty collection. When this is , the and properties are non-empty.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.Build
member.summary: The build metadata for this version.
member.value: The build metadata for this version or empty string if there is no build metadata.

remarks.para: The build metadata is a series of dot separated identifiers separated from the rest of the version number with a plus sign ('+'). Valid metadata identifiers are non-empty and consist of ASCII alphanumeric characters and hyphens ([0-9A-Za-z-]).

The metadata does not affect precedence. Two version numbers differing only in build metadata have the same precedence. However, metadata does affect sort order. An otherwise identical version without metadata sorts before one that has metadata.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.Metadata
member.summary: The build metadata for this version.
member.value: The build metadata for this version or empty string if there is no metadata.

remarks.para: The build metadata is a series of dot separated identifiers separated from the rest of the version number with a plus sign ('+'). Valid metadata identifiers are non-empty and consist of ASCII alphanumeric characters and hyphens ([0-9A-Za-z-]).

The metadata does not affect precedence. Two version numbers differing only in build metadata have the same precedence. However, metadata does affect sort order. An otherwise identical version without metadata sorts before one that has metadata.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.MetadataIdentifiers
member.summary: The build metadata identifiers for this version.
member.value: The build metadata identifiers for this version or empty if there is no metadata.

remarks.para: The build metadata is a series of dot separated identifiers separated from the rest of the version number with a plus sign ('+'). Valid metadata identifiers are non-empty and consist of ASCII alphanumeric characters and hyphens ([0-9A-Za-z-]).

The metadata does not affect precedence. Two version numbers differing only in build metadata have the same precedence. However, metadata does affect sort order. An otherwise identical version without metadata sorts before one that has metadata.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.ToString
member.summary: Converts this version to an equivalent string value.
member.returns: The equivalent of this version.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.Equals(Semver.SemVersion,Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Determines whether two semantic versions are equal.
member.returns: if the two values are equal, otherwise .
member.remarks: Two versions are equal if every part of the version numbers are equal. Thus two versions with the same precedence may not be equal.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the given object is equal to this version.
member.returns: if is equal to the this version; otherwise .
member.remarks: Two versions are equal if every part of the version numbers are equal. Thus two versions with the same precedence may not be equal.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.Equals(Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Determines whether two semantic versions are equal.
member.returns: if is equal to the this version; otherwise .
member.remarks: Two versions are equal if every part of the version numbers are equal. Thus two versions with the same precedence may not be equal.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.PrecedenceEquals(Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Determines whether two semantic versions have the same precedence. Versions that differ only by build metadata have the same precedence.
member.param: The semantic version to compare to.
member.returns: if the version precedences are equal, otherwise .

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.PrecedenceEquals(Semver.SemVersion,Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Determines whether two semantic versions have the same precedence. Versions that differ only by build metadata have the same precedence.
member.returns: if the version precedences are equal, otherwise .

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.PrecedenceMatches(Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Determines whether two semantic versions have the same precedence. Versions that differ only by build metadata have the same precedence.
member.param: The semantic version to compare to.
member.returns: if the version precedences are equal.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A hash code for this instance, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
member.remarks: Two versions are equal if every part of the version numbers are equal. Thus two versions with the same precedence may not have the same hash code.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.op_Equality(Semver.SemVersion,Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Determines whether two semantic versions are equal.
member.returns: if the two values are equal, otherwise .
member.remarks: Two versions are equal if every part of the version numbers are equal. Thus two versions with the same precedence may not be equal.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.op_Inequality(Semver.SemVersion,Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Determines whether two semantic versions are not equal.
member.returns: if the two values are not equal, otherwise .
member.remarks: Two versions are equal if every part of the version numbers are equal. Thus two versions with the same precedence may not be equal.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.PrecedenceComparer
member.summary: An and that compares by precedence. This can be used for sorting, binary search, and using as a dictionary key.
member.value: A precedence comparer that implements and for .

remarks.para: Precedence order is determined by comparing the major, minor, patch, and prerelease portion in order from left to right. Versions that differ only by build metadata have the same precedence. The major, minor, and patch version numbers are compared numerically. A prerelease version precedes a release version.

The prerelease portion is compared by comparing each prerelease identifier from left to right. Numeric prerelease identifiers precede alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared numerically. Alphanumeric identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. A longer series of prerelease identifiers follows a shorter series if all the preceding identifiers are equal.

member.name: P:Semver.SemVersion.SortOrderComparer
member.summary: An and that compares by sort order. This can be used for sorting, binary search, and using as a dictionary key.
member.value: A sort order comparer that implements and for .

remarks.para: Sort order is consistent with precedence order, but provides an order for versions with the same precedence. Sort order is determined by comparing the major, minor, patch, prerelease portion, and build metadata in order from left to right. The major, minor, and patch version numbers are compared numerically. A prerelease version precedes a release version.

The prerelease portion is compared by comparing each prerelease identifier from left to right. Numeric prerelease identifiers precede alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared numerically. Alphanumeric identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. A longer series of prerelease identifiers follows a shorter series if all the preceding identifiers are equal.

Otherwise equal versions without build metadata precede those with metadata. The build metadata is compared by comparing each metadata identifier. Identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. A longer series of metadata identifiers follows a shorter series if all the preceding identifiers are equal.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.ComparePrecedenceTo(Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Compares two versions and indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or is in the same position as the other in the precedence order. Versions that differ only by build metadata have the same precedence.
member.returns:
An integer that indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or is in the same position as in the precedence order.
Value Condition
-1 This instance precedes in the precedence order.
0 This instance has the same precedence as .
1
This instance follows in the precedence order or is .

remarks.para: Precedence order is determined by comparing the major, minor, patch, and prerelease portion in order from left to right. Versions that differ only by build metadata have the same precedence. The major, minor, and patch version numbers are compared numerically. A prerelease version precedes a release version.

The prerelease portion is compared by comparing each prerelease identifier from left to right. Numeric prerelease identifiers precede alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared numerically. Alphanumeric identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. A longer series of prerelease identifiers follows a shorter series if all the preceding identifiers are equal.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersion.CompareSortOrderTo(Semver.SemVersion)
member.summary: Compares two versions and indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or is equal to the other in the sort order. Note that sort order is more specific than precedence order.
member.returns:
An integer that indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or is equal to the other in the sort order.
Value Condition
-1 This instance precedes the other in the sort order.
0 This instance is equal to the other.
1
This instance follows the other in the sort order or the other is .

remarks.para: Sort order is consistent with precedence order, but provides an order for versions with the same precedence. Sort order is determined by comparing the major, minor, patch, prerelease portion, and build metadata in order from left to right. The major, minor, and patch version numbers are compared numerically. A prerelease version precedes a release version.

The prerelease portion is compared by comparing each prerelease identifier from left to right. Numeric prerelease identifiers precede alphanumeric identifiers. Numeric identifiers are compared numerically. Alphanumeric identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. A longer series of prerelease identifiers follows a shorter series if all the preceding identifiers are equal.

Otherwise equal versions without build metadata precede those with metadata. The build metadata is compared by comparing each metadata identifier. Identifiers are compared lexically in ASCII sort order. A longer series of metadata identifiers follows a shorter series if all the preceding identifiers are equal.

precedes in the precedence order or is .

member.name: T:Semver.SemVersionParser
member.summary: Parsing for
member.remarks: The new parsing code was complex enough that is made sense to break out into its own class.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersionParser.Parse(System.String,Semver.SemVersionStyles,System.Exception,System.Int32,Semver.SemVersion@)
member.summary:
The internal method that all parsing is based on. Because this is called by both and
it does not throw exceptions, but instead returns the exception that should be thrown by the parse method. For performance when used from try parse, all exception construction and message formatting can be avoided by passing in an exception which will be returned when parsing fails.
member.remarks: This does not validate the or parameter values. That must be done in the calling method.

summary.para:
Determines the styles that are allowed in version strings passed to the and
methods. These styles only affect which strings are accepted when parsing. The constructed version numbers are valid semantic versions without any of the optional features in the original string.
This enumeration supports a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.Strict
member.summary: Accept version strings strictly conforming to the SemVer 2.0 spec.

summary.para: Allow leading zeros on major, minor, patch, and prerelease version numbers.
Leading zeros will be removed from the constructed version number.

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.AllowLeadingWhitespace
member.summary: Allow leading whitespace. When combined with leading "v", the whitespace must come before the "v".

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.AllowTrailingWhitespace
member.summary: Allow trailing whitespace.

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.AllowWhitespace
member.summary: Allow leading and/or trailing whitespace. When combined with leading "v", the leading whitespace must come before the "v".

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.AllowLowerV
member.summary: Allow a leading lowercase "v".

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.AllowUpperV
member.summary: Allow a leading uppercase "V".

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.AllowV
member.summary: Allow a leading "v" or "V".

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.OptionalPatch
member.summary: Patch version number is optional.

member.name: F:Semver.SemVersionStyles.OptionalMinorPatch
member.summary: Minor and patch version numbers are optional.

summary.para: Accept any version string format supported.
The formats accepted by this style will change if/when more formats are supported.

member.name: M:Semver.SemVersionStylesExtensions.HasStyle(Semver.SemVersionStyles,Semver.SemVersionStyles)
member.summary: The method is surprisingly slow. This provides a fast alternative for the enum.

member.name: M:Semver.Utility.CharExtensions.IsDigit(System.Char)
member.summary: Is this character an ASCII digit '0' through '9'

member.name: M:Semver.Utility.CharExtensions.IsAlphaOrHyphen(System.Char)
member.summary: Is this character and ASCII alphabetic character or hyphen [A-Za-z-]

member.name: T:Semver.Utility.CombinedHashCode
member.summary: Combine hash codes in a good way since System.HashCode isn't available.
member.remarks: Algorithm based on HashHelpers previously used in the core CLR. https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/456afea9fbe721e57986a21eb3b4bb1c9c7e4c56/src/System.Private.CoreLib/shared/System/Numerics/Hashing/HashHelpers.cs

member.name: T:Semver.Utility.IdentifierString
member.summary: Methods for working with the strings that make up identifiers

member.name: M:Semver.Utility.IdentifierString.Compare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compare two strings as they should be compared as identifiers.
member.remarks: This enforces ordinal comparision. It also fixes a technically correct but odd thing where the comparision result can be a number other than -1, 0, or 1.

member.name: M:Semver.Utility.IntExtensions.DecimalDigits(System.Int32)
member.summary: The number of digits in a non-negative number. Returns 1 for all negative numbers. That is ok because we are using it to calculate string length for a for numbers that aren't supposed to be negative, but when they are it is just a little slower.
member.remarks: This approach is based on https://stackoverflow.com/a/51099524/268898 where the poster offers performance benchmarks showing this is the fastest way to get a number of digits.

member.name: T:Semver.Utility.ReadOnlyList`1
member.summary: Internal helper for efficiently creating empty read only lists

member.name: M:Semver.Utility.StringExtensions.IsDigits(System.String)
member.summary: Is this string composed entirely of ASCII digits '0' to '9'?

member.name: M:Semver.Utility.StringExtensions.IsAlphanumericOrHyphens(System.String)
member.summary: Is this string composed entirely of ASCII alphanumeric characters and hyphens?

member.name: M:Semver.Utility.StringExtensions.SplitAndMapToReadOnlyList``1(System.String,System.Char,System.Func{System.String,``0})
member.summary: Split a string, map the parts, and return a read only list of the values.
member.remarks:
Splitting a string, mapping the result and storing into a is a common operation in this package. This method optimizes that. It avoids the performance overhead of:
Constructing the params array for
Constructing the intermediate returned by
Not allocating list capacity based on the size
Benchmarking shows this to be 30%+ faster and that may not reflect the whole benefit since it doesn't fully account for reduced allocations.

member.name: M:Semver.Utility.StringExtensions.TrimLeadingZeros(System.String)
member.summary: Trim leading zeros from a numeric string. If the string consists of all zeros, return "0".
member.remarks: The standard method handles all zeros by returning "". This efficiently handles the kind of trimming needed.

member.name: T:Semver.Utility.UnsafeOverload
member.summary: Struct used as a marker to differentiate constructor overloads that would otherwise be the same as safe overloads.
